intro: Elatostema variolaminosum var. latum, commonly known as the broad-leafed elatostema, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle and related plants. The plant features small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces tiny, greenish-white flowers in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
